result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, including the sentence in case 15CM357.

miscConds.notes:
Hearing 9/25/2015.

09-25-15/ Lindsey Grady
Court ordered restitution set at $0

Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  All mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge. Court will waive all costs, fees, surcharges that it is able to, due to an inability to pay.

No contact with Jessica B.
No possession of firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles L Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles L Johnson not in court, Defendant in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered restitution to be set at ZERO.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, including the sentence in case #15CM357.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-Complete a domestic violence class
-Absolute sobriety
-No contact with Jessica B.
-No possession of firearms
-Pay a DNA surcharge
-Obtain/maintain employment

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).  Court will waive all costs, fees, and surcharges that it is able to, due to an inability to pay.

Appeal rights given.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit


 Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by state that the motion for joinder with 15cm357 in Branch 47 was denied.  Parties requests a status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by state that defendant has a pending case in Branch 47.  State requests motion hearing date to join cases. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
STATE'S NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR JOINDER FOR TRIAL, filed. jks
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant to report for booking and release no later than 3:00 p.m. on 03-21-2015.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jessica B.    AND/OR   her residence     AND/OR   her place of employment

No dangerous weapons
No firearms

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.

Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with Attorney J. Dennis Thornton, appearing as a friend of the court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-055
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Defendant has a lower number case pending in Branch 47.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  
Clerk:  jms
